page.title: 01 Introduction
page.content: The area of the survey is sited midwa between the settlements of Cheltenham & Cirencester.This is part of the Cotswold limestone escarpent,ranging in height from 150 to 250m above sea level The area is drained by the River Churn & its tributaries.In ecology the western half of the area consists of the valley of the Churn in which deciduous & coniferous woodland occupied a third of the land & a number of bird & plant species are found.The economy of the area is essentially based on farming with dairy cattle, sheep,cereal & fodder crops represented.The landscape & buildings are very much part of the Cotswolds eg honey coloured limestone used for farm buildings cottages etc.Within the area there are no village communities,only isolated farms & houses.
